column4: flannel and others: maybe it's The Wrong Way To Do It but let me take a little side trip here and explain: i've been a mac os user for over 20 years -- ever since 1984 -- i don't mean the new mac os x (which is a fake mac gui on top of bsd); i mean the real original mac os, now sometimes called 'classic'
we do everything in mac os with a gui and we do all sysadmin tasks that way and if you screw it up, you are screwed, so you learn never to screw up sysadmin tasks
the notion of all this root vs user login stuff just seems silly to me
